availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Booth Parsons (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, Methodist preacher. )

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, actor and minister (Methodist). Hartford County, Connecticut, native. Married to Emily C. Oldham Parsons in Floyd County, Indiana, on December 7, 1830. Father of Charles W. Parsons, Henry B. Parsons, Arabella C. Parsons, Edward Y. Parsons, Frank Parsons, and Clarence W. Parsons. Minister in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Minister in Louisville in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
